title: Drawing, "Shelving Unit", September 30, 1933
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower left: DONALD DESKEY/145 WEST 57TH STREET/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at lower left: K. 9/30/33/NOTE! BASE TO FIT IN OPEN TOP./WOOD COMB.#2 OF BEDROOM 7236/BOMBAY ROSEWOOD & BLACK LACQUER; inscribed in graphite at lower left: 8; inscribed in red color pencil at lower right: P; inscribed dimensions, instructions, materials
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawing for small shelving unit/bookcase. Rounded corners at front, squared edges in back. Tray-like space on top of unit for books; two open shelves below. Bombay rosewood around cornice of unit and black lacquer covering remaining surface.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Shelving Unit", September 30, 1933.
September 30, 1933. Graphite on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1988-101-868.
